intro: Sageretia wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan sageretia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually oval or elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, and bloom in the spring. Sageretia wallichii is adapted to cold, mountainous environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
